title: Hausman’s analysis of two meanings of the perceptual judgment in Peirce’s philosophy does not correspond with the distinction being made here
All these distinctions are discussed by Rosenthal (1969) in some detail, but the others need not be introduced here
His highly perceptive analysis goes astray here because he remains too general in his discussion of perceptual judgments
